I joined CWI as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow in 2017 and later progressed to Lecturer and Senior Lecturer in 2019 and 2024, respectively. I earned my PhD under the prestigious Erasmus Mundus Doctoral Scholarship (now Marie‑Skłodowska‑Curie Actions) with the final degree awarded by Frederick University. I received my M.S. degree in Electrical Engineering from the National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), SEECS, and my B.S. degree in Electrical (Telecommunication) Engineering from COMSATS-UI. I am a Senior Member IEEE, Senior Member URSI, Fellow of the UK Higher Education Academy, IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society (AP-S) Young Professional Ambassador, and IET Young Professional since 2024, 22, 22, and 17, respectively. I was honoured with the Grand Prize of the Mobile World Scholar Challenge at the Mobile World Congress (MWC) in 2019. My research grant portfolio as Principle Investigator and Co-Investigator includes academic ownership of over £1.66 million.
